title: Old Is Indeed Gold! Throwback Clip Of SRK Anchoring A Doordarshan Show Is Making Fans Nostalgic
text:
Old Is Indeed Gold! Throwback Clip Of SRK Anchoring A Doordarshan Show Is Making Fans Nostalgic

Old Is Indeed Gold! Throwback Clip Of SRK Anchoring A Doordarshan Show Is Making Fans Nostalgic

Throwback often finds a new meaning on social media as fans know how to dig out pictures and videos that are pure gold!

An old video of Shah Rukh Khan, anchoring a New Years eve show in the early ‘90s is going viral on the internet and it's special for reasons more than one.

The video initially shared on Twitter by an account called Bollywood Direct shows Shah Rukh interacting with his co-anchor. Later, they both introduce Kumar Sanu on the stage to perform. “Kumar Sanu, wohi hai jo Kishore Kumar ke andaaz main gaatey hain?” Shah Rukh asks his co-anchor and the video is garnering praises from SRK fans.





Before finding his way to films, SRK made his acting debut with TV series Fauji.

Don't Miss 462 SHARES 103 SHARES 514 SHARES 22.8 K SHARES 553 SHARES

Later, he made his dream debut in 1992, with Deewana. He then went on to doing films including Raju Ban Gaya Gentleman and King Uncle, Baazigar and Darr.

Just to jog your memory a little, most of SRK's songs in the 90's from films like Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge and Karan Arjun were sung by Kumar Sanu. A lot of fans found themselves taking a trip to nostalgia and good old days of 90's.

One fan comment on the post reads, “Kumar Sanu would have never imagined that he would sing most number of songs for the anchor!”

Woooow !! What a journey 👌🏻👌🏻 — Prachi (@prachipanchal) October 3, 2019

Wow thank you for this ❤️ — Priyanka 👑 (@PriyankaSRKian) October 3, 2019

That hairstyle

Was quite a craze those days — Rafat Sohail (@rafatsohail) October 3, 2019

What a find! :) — Strange Thing (@TintzS) October 3, 2019

And then with in few years who would have thought the guy he was introducing will be his voice in Baazigar for hit song yeh kaali kaali aankhein — Aman sharma (@giddyup8765) October 3, 2019

Anyone who can get me this song or video of this show will get Rs.5000 prize from me... Thanks — NADIR UMAR SHEIKH (@nus786) October 4, 2019

On the work front, SRK has taken a voluntarily break after his last critical and commercial failure, Zero.

Talking about his break, SRK said, “I am taking time. I am thinking. I am working on two-three scripts and as soon as they are ready, because I am ready and most of the people working are ready, I will announce it. Till that time, whatever rumours are going around, some of them have given me ideas.”

Recently, at a press conference, SRK said that he will be announcing his next film very soon.
description: An old video of Shah Rukh Khan, anchoring a New Years eve show in the early ‘90s is going viral on the internet and it's special for reasons more than one. The video initially shared on Twitter by an account called Bollywood Direct shows Shah Rukh interacting with his co-anchor.
